title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
OB: When a file is already opened in one editor in the software, and the user tries to open the same file in another editor, nothing happens. No warning message or error message is displayed.
EB: The software should display a warning message or error message when the user tries to open a file that is already opened in one editor, indicating that the user cannot open the file in another editor until it is closed in the currently open editor.
SR:
To reproduce:
1. Make sure you have an associate Windows editor for your Java file. If not, go to the file explorer, double click on any Java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all Java files.
2. In the Java Perspective, right click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'. A Notepad or WordPad window will open with the Java file.
3. Close the Notepad or WordPad window.
4. Go to the Java Perspective and open a Java file by double-clicking on it. The file is now opened in the workbench.
5. Right click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.

Expected: The software should display a warning message or error message indicating that opening the file in another editor is not allowed until it is closed in the currently open editor.
